B.text: Attack yields a brief climate change.

C.text: You give foe's cheeks a rosy hue.

D.text: Your blast looks good, works poorly.

E.text: Sharp and cold air assaults foe's skin.

A.text: Feeble and poorly directed. Foe is not really concerned.

B.text: Burst of cold causes target mild discomfort.

C.text: Your attack conjures a bitter arctic wind. Foe is not impressed.

D.text: Foe shields himself. Your attack misses most of its mark.

E.text: Ice up the ground and foe's feet. He springs clear. You have initiative.

A.text: Foe dodges your attack with too much effort. You have initiative.

B.text: Foe evades frantically. He is still chilled. You have initiative next round.

C.text: Encrust foe with ice. He is unbalanced as he shakes it off. You gain initiative.

D.text: Light frosting leaves foe unsteady. You must hit him again.

E.text: Frigid strike to foe's torso and face. You have the initiative.

A.text: Foe is fearful of your assault. Your attack gives you the initiative.

B.text: Assault blinds foe for a moment. You have 2 rounds of initiative.

C.text: Numbing whirlwind encircles foe. You have 2 rounds of initiative.

D.text: Foe's attempts to evade and strikes himself. You try not to laugh.

E.text: Foe's failed efforts to avoid your attack puts him at a grave disadvantage.

A.text: Burst of cold to the face sends foe stumbling back. You have initiative for 2 rounds.

B.text: Frost laden blast forces foe back. Any containers of water freeze and burst open. You have 2 rounds of initiative.

C.text: Disorient foe with a tricky shot. His garments have failed to keep out the chill. Press him while you can.

D.text: With a burst of white, you shower foe with ice crystals. Foe closes his eyes to avoid the onslaught.

E.text: Freeze foe's hair and scalp. If foe has long hair, it breaks off! Foe struggles in vain to repair the damage.

A.text: Your attack freezes one of foe's metal items. Foe takes a defensive stance.

B.text: Foe makes a futile attempt to parry the attack;. He loses 3 rounds of initiative.

C.text: Catch foe in lower leg. You gain initiative while foe regains footing.

D.text: Foe ices down; freezing any exposed skin. The pain is great.

E.text: Assault to foe's legs. Hypothermic, he struggles to remain standing.

A.text: Scatter your attack all over foe's chest. Foe is covered with frost. He looks ghoulish.

B.text: Cold penetrates foe's chest and gives him frostbite. The pain must be severe. He stumbles back.

C.text: Blast hits foe's chest and scatters. The cold stings all exposed skin. Foe has a shocked look on his face.

D.text: Assault lands on foe's weapon arm. He makes a supreme effort to pull his arm away. Foe is unable to protect himself.

E.text: Glancing strike to lower back. Foe is spun about and slings his weapon away. You have him now.

A.text: Blow to foe's chest. Your attack has force and foe stumbles.

B.text: Strong off-center blast takes foe in his shield arm wrist and side.

C.text: Hard strike to chest, armor does not help. Blow leaves its frigid mark.

D.text: Heavy blow to shield shoulder. Foe is knocked back 5 feet. Muscle damage.

E.text: Blow to side. Foe seeks to regain his wind and survive your next onslaught.

A.text: Strike falls on an exposed area. Foe gives ground. He is shaken but his guard is still up.

B.text: Foe turns to avoid your attack and exposes his back. All wood on his back becomes frozen and brittle.

C.text: Strong blast hits foe low. His legs almost give with the pain. Foe recoils 5 feet away from your assault.

D.text: Miss foe's arm and strike his thigh. He loses his footing. Skin and nerve damage causes foe pain.

E.text: Your blast engulfs foe's weapon arm and climbs toward his torso. He steps away frantic to evade the pain.

A.text: Well placed. Strike slams into foe's weapon arm. Foe's evasion is comical.

B.text: Solid strike to foe's forearm. Foe's hand frozen shut for 1 round.

C.text: Blast freeze dries organic material on foe's back.

D.text: Blast freezes foe's arm and shield. If no shield,arm useless from nerve damage.

E.text: Strike to foe's waist. All equipment on belt freezes and breaks if foe moves.

A.text: Steal the heat from foe's neck and chest area. Foe drops anything he is holding and blocks his throat.

B.text: Foe is covered by the blast. All extremities are damaged. The pain grows until foe is warmed up.

C.text: Foe's response to your burst of cold sends him to the ground hard. Foe jams his wrist into the ground.

D.text: Frigid onslaught fills foes eyes and mouth with ice. Foe is blinded for a moment until he can clear his eyes.

E.text: Your strike steals the heat out of foe's neck and upper chest. Nerves and muscles are damaged.

A.text: Score a hit to foe's side. It produces mild frostbite. Any herbs on foe's belt are ruined.

B.text: Spray foe's face with a powerful chill. He tries without success to push your attack away . The damage endures.

C.text: Freeze foe's weapon arm. It is useless until it is warmed up. Foe is in great pain and stuggles to stand.

D.text: Polar wind pierces deep into chest and leaves foe trembling. You are close to victory. Foe faces the wrong way

E.text: Blow to foe's shield arm. He is knocked down. If foe has a shield, it is broken. If not, the arm is broken.

A.text: Strong unbalancing blast. Foe's body temperature drops.

B.text: Strike lands on foe's legs. The pain and shock cause him to falter.

C.text: Side strike hits foe just right. Any leather or cloth freezes and shatters.

D.text: Blast drains the heat from foe's weapon arm. Hand and arm are useless. The hand is frozen closed.

E.text: Blast freezes weapon hand, shoulder and face. Foe is numb and needs time to warm up. Foe is still standing.

A.text: Strike to foe's shield arm. If foe sees it he may block with a shield. Foe recoils 5 feet from the blast.

B.text: Chest strike freezes what it touches. Equipment is damaged. The pain persists. Chest armor is destroyed.

C.text: Blow to foe's arms. Any metal armguards freeze, immobilizing arms until the armor is removed or unfrozen.

D.text: Strike to foe's side downs him. Severe frostbite hampers movements. Any liquid among foe's equipment freezes.

E.text: Solid chest strike. Foe flips onto his back , dropping all he holds. Foe is at your mercy.

A.text: Back blast. Any glass on back is broken. Painful bruise.

B.text: Clean hard strike pushes foe over, cracking ribs. His recovery lacks grace.

C.text: Arctic blast to foe's torso. Foe is badly frostbitten and falls to knees in pain.

D.text: Freezes foe's hands. Arms are useless. Foe drops what he was carrying.

E.text: Assault to throat and face is terminal. Foe is still active but dies in 12 rounds.

A.text: Assault to foe's lower leg freezes part of it. Foe falls down. Without leg armor, foot must be amputated.

B.text: Strike lower leg and freeze it. With leg armor, he needs aid in 20 rnds to keep the foot. Without leg armor, it's gone.

C.text: Blow to foe's knees. They freeze up and foe falls. On impact, foe shatters a knee. His fall makes it twice as bad.

D.text: Chest hit causes much pain. If foe is warmly clothed he is knocked out. If not he dies of shock in 12 rounds.

E.text: Your ruthless tempest entangles foe and steals the warmth from his body. He drops and dies in 9 inactive rounds

A.text: Blow lands on foe's face. It freezes his nose, ears and cheeks. Foe collapses. Without helm, foe loses both ears.

B.text: Connect with foe's hip. Hip is fractured. Skin and muscles are frostbitten. Foe falls down. He is almost helpless.

C.text: Freeze the blood in foe's thigh. As it warms the clots move to his heart killing him in 9 rounds.

D.text: All warmth is driven from foe's lower body. Vital organs are destroyed. Foe is immobile, and dies in 9 rounds.

E.text: Push foe backwards and off balance. The blood in foe's extremeties is frozen. He dies in 6 rounds of agony.

A.text: Chest strike sends foe over hard. He is knocked out. His lips freeze and split open. He cannot speak for 2 weeks.

B.text: Blast foe's neck and collarbone. Neck armor will block the attack, but foe is knocked out. If the neck is exposed it freezes solid and foe dies in 9 rounds.

C.text: Your onslaught freezes foe's torso and head. Foe remains standing for a moment. He goes into shock and dies 6 rounds later.

D.text: Foe's heart and lungs are suddenly frozen by your arctic blast. Foe is finished. He dies of shock and suffocation in 6 rounds.

E.text: Foe is a lifeless frozen statue. He is quite dead and well preserved. Store in a cool dry place.

A.text: Foe is sent into a month long coma by the attack. He loses his nose to frostbite.

B.text: Assault drops foe's body temperature; his heart stops. He dies in 1 round; well preserved. You are respected by all.

C.text: Blast freezes foe's eyes, mouth, and neck. Foe falls down in a coma for 2 weeks and paralyzed from neck down.

D.text: Massive assault freezes foe's body completely. He remains standing, but if knocked over he will shatter.

E.text: Foe freezes solid and shatters into a thousand pieces. Most land within 20 feet from where he was standing
